ca.mcgill.ecse211.project
Class LightLocalizer

java.lang.Object
  ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightLocalizer

public class LightLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the light localization which uses the color sensor to know where the robot is from the origin.

Field Summary
 double currentTheta
          The corrected theta (the exact direction the robot is facing).
 
Constructor Summary
LightLocalizer(Odometer odometer, Navigation navigation)
          The constructor for the class that initializes the odometer and navigation objects as well as the fields utilized to update the sensor's data.
 
Method Summary
 void adjustPosition()
          This method is used before the first localization to make sure the robot will hit the 4 axes during the light localization.
 void doLightLocalization()
          This method executes the first light localization.
 void midpointLocalization()
          This method executes all light localizations during the Navigation.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

currentTheta

public double currentTheta
The corrected theta (the exact direction the robot is facing).

Constructor Detail

LightLocalizer

public LightLocalizer(Odometer odometer,
                      Navigation navigation)
The constructor for the class that initializes the odometer and navigation objects as well as the fields utilized to update the sensor's data.

Parameters:
odometer - pointer to the Odometer
navigation - pointer to the Navigation class
Method Detail

doLightLocalization

public void doLightLocalization()
This method executes the first light localization.

adjustPosition

public void adjustPosition()
This method is used before the first localization to make sure the robot will hit the 4 axes during the light localization.

midpointLocalization

public void midpointLocalization()
This method executes all light localizations during the Navigation. It uses mostly the same structure as the doLightLocalization() method.
